answerText: The Labyrinth of Solitude [or El Laberinto de la Soledad][10] Identify the Mexican author of The Labyrinth of Solitude who also wrote the 584-line cyclical poem "Sunstone," which reflects the 584-day circular Aztec calendar.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale B + Bellarmine  | 12 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Several editions of this book also contain the author's stand-alone essay "The Philanthropic Ogre," which discusses the suffocating nature of his country's government. For 10 points each: [10] Name this collection of nine essays, including "The Sons of La Malinche" and "Mexican Masks," that discusses Mexican identity as being constituted from two different cultures, the indigenous and the Spanish.
